channel.title: American on Loving my tummy
channel.description: Recent content in American on Loving my tummy

item.title: Apple cinnamon oatmeal cookies
item.description: Peel and chop finely the apples (0.5 cm cubes or smaller). Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F) degrees. Line two 45x30 cm baking sheets with silicone baking mats or parchment paper. In a mixing bowl whisk together flour, oats, cinnamon, baking soda and salt for 20 seconds, set aside. In the bowl of an electric stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment cream together butter and brown sugar until combined. Mix in egg and vanilla extract.

item.title: Bacon cheeseburger
item.description: Prepare the bacon: Heat a skillet over medium heat. Cook the bacon slices until crispy, about 4-5 minutes per side. Remove and place on paper towels to drain excess grease. Form the burger patty: Shape the ground beef into a round patty, slightly larger than the bun. Press a small indent in the center with your thumb. Season both sides with salt and pepper. Cook the patty: Heat a grill or skillet over medium-high heat.

item.title: Cajun fries
item.description: Prepare the potatoes: Wash, dry, and cut the potato into 1/4" strips. Toss them in peanut oil until evenly coated. Air fry: Cook in an air fryer at 200°C (400°F) for 15 minutes until golden brown. Seasoning blend: Mix all the remaining ingredients into a cajun seasoning blend. Toss with spices: Toss the fries with 1/2 to 3/4 of the seasoning blend. Return them to the air fryer for 4-6 minutes at 200°C (400°F).

item.title: Chicago-style hot dog
item.description: Quantities for 1 serving. Prepare the hot dogs: Steam or boil the hot dogs according to package instructions. If you prefer a grilled flavor, you can grill them until heated through. Prepare the buns: Steam the poppy seed buns for a few minutes until soft and warm. You can use a steamer or wrap them in a damp paper towel and microwave them briefly. Assemble the hot dogs: Place each hot dog into a steamed poppy seed bun.

item.title: Chocolate & Banana bar
item.description: Place the banana slices on a board or tray lined with parchment or baking paper. Add the peanut butter, then the nuts (e.g., peanuts, almonds, pistachios,…) on top, and finally the melted chocolate. You can sprinkle some salt or more nuts on top as decoration. Freeze for at least 1 hour. Cut it in pieces. Storage Store in the freezer in an airtight container or plastic bag. It lasts 3 to 4 months!

item.title: Chocolate Chip "Wonderbread"
item.description: Prepare Batter: In a stand mixer, combine the egg white powder and water. Beat until stiff peaks form. Combine Ingredients: Gently fold in the Greek yogurt, being careful not to overmix. Add the chocolate chips and fold until just combined. Bake: Transfer the batter into an oiled baking tin. Bake in a preheated oven at 180°C (350°F) for about 30 minutes, or until the top is golden brown. Cool and Serve: Allow to cool slightly.

item.title: Cottage cheese & banana cake
item.description: Add all of your ingredients for the Cheesecake into a food processor or blender. Process or blend everything together until smooth. Pour your mix into your Cheesecake dish or pan. Bake on 160°C (325°F) for around 20-25 minutes. Let it cool, wrap it up, and put it into the fridge for a few hours. Adaptation from The Protein Chef.

item.title: KFC-style chicken nuggets
item.description: Cut the chicken breasts into medium-large cubes or strips and place them in a bowl. Add the oil, yogurt, and spices. Stir and let marinate for 30 minutes. Coat each piece in flour, then in beaten egg, and finally in crushed cornflakes (in that order). Place them on a baking tray lined with baking paper and cook at 180°C (350°F) for 20 minutes, or in an Airfryer. Serve with sauce.

item.title: Loaded fries
item.description: Loaded fries is a dish consisting of French fries topped with a combination of cheese, sauces, meat (commonly bacon) and vegetables. Ingredients for 1 serving. Prepare the fries: Cut the potatos into fries. Preheat the oven to 200°C (400°F) or heat the oil in a frying pan. Cook the fries: If baking, toss the fries in a little olive oil and spread them on a baking sheet. Bake for 25-30 minutes, turning halfway through until golden and crispy.

item.title: Mini Chocolate Tartlets
item.description: For 2 small tartlets. Combine the cornflakes with the melted chocolate. Press the mixture firmly into two pre-greased mini tart molds to form the base. Chill in the fridge for 20 minutes. Fill the tarts with peanut butter and sprinkle chopped walnuts on top. Finally, cover with more melted chocolate (use as much as chocolate as needed). Let them cool in the fridge. From Instagram @levartenutricion.

item.title: Mug cake
item.description: For 1 serving. Tips If you use unsalted butter, add 1/8 teaspoon of salt. You can substitute the butter by oil (2-3 teaspoons) or mashed banana. If you want a larger portion, simply double the recipe and cook it in a medium-sized microwave-safe bowl, transforming this receipt in a bowl cake. Preparation In a microwave-safe mug, melt the butter in the microwave for about 20-30 seconds. Mix all the dry ingredients thoroughly until well combined.

item.title: Oreo ice cream pop
item.description: Crush the cookies: Without opening the Oreo package, crush the cookies inside until they become fine crumbs. Add milk: Open the package slightly and pour in milk until it fills the package. Mix gently by shaking. Insert the stick: Pierce the package with the wooden stick, positioning it in the center. Freeze: Place the package in the freezer and let it freeze completely (about 4-6 hours). Unwrap: Once frozen, carefully remove the Oreo ice cream from the package.

item.title: Outback Blooming Onion
item.description: Prepare the Onion: Keep the root of the onion intact to hold it together. Slice off the top and peel the outer layer. Place the onion face down and cut it into quarters, then quarter it again once or twice more, depending on the size of the onion. Soak in ice water: Let the cut onion sit in ice water for a few minutes. This helps the layers separate and gives the onion a crisp texture.

item.title: Pear upside-down cake
item.description: Bottom: Using 2 pears, place the pear slices along the bottom of the tin spreading them out and covering the entire bottom of the tin. Sponge: Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F). Add the butter, sugar and vanilla extract into a bowl and combine well into a smooth paste like texture. Add in the flour, baking powder, pear purée and mix into a thick smooth batter. Spoon this batter over the pears into your lined tin and spread it out evenly.

item.title: Super banana cookie
item.description: Mix Ingredients: In a bowl, mash the banana until smooth. Add the egg, oat flour, vanilla extract, and cocoa powder. Stir until you have a smooth, thick batter. Shape the Cookie: Form a large cookie shape with the batter, or divide it into smaller portions if you prefer multiple cookies. Place parchment paper in the air fryer basket to prevent sticking. Cook in the Air Fryer: Preheat the air fryer to 180°C (350°F).

item.title: Taco burger
item.description: Place the burger patty on the wheat tortilla and press it down well so that it almost covers the tortilla and sticks to it. Fry the egg on a griddle or in a pan. Cook the burger on the griddle with the tortilla facing down. Flip it over and add a slice of your favorite cheese and cover with a lid to melt the cheese. Add your favorite sauce (BBQ, mustard, ketchup,…), and finally, place the fried egg on top.

item.title: Yogurt banana cake
item.description: Mash the bananas: In a bowl, mash the bananas until smooth. Mix ingredients: Add the yogurt, eggs, and sweetener or vanilla extract. Mix until well combined. Preheat the oven or Air-Fryer: Preheat your oven to 180°C (350°F). Prepare the pan: Grease a cake pan or line it with parchment paper. Pour the mixture: Pour the batter into the prepared pan and smooth the top. Bake: Bake in the oven for 50 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
